result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ronald K. Markley Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes appeared by video for Ronald K. Markley Jr. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE qualifies for PD representation.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends $100 cash bond.  Atty Hayes recommends signature bond or no more than $250 cash  $100.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute sobriety at all times.  No possession of alcohol.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores or any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  No possession of controlled substances without a valid Rx.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.  DE may return one time, upon prior notice and with LE to retrieve any personal belongings.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Return date scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
